title: Evaporative Canister (if fitted) - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
If the engine has recently been running, the exhaust components can be hot.
Always allow the hot components to cool before working on the exhaust system.
Contact with the hot components could cause minor to moderate burns to exposed skin.
Battery Disconnect DV; DVX; DVY; DW; DW4; DX4; DWB; DVB

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DWB; DVB; DVY; DX4; DW4; DW; DVX; DV

body.body: Remove the right hand exhaust silencer (see
Airbox Removal DV; DVX; DVY; DW; DW4; DX4; DWB; DVB

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DWB; DVB; DX4; DW4; DW; DVX; DVY; DV

body.body: Raise and Support Rear of Motorcycle
Raise and support the rear of the motorcycle under the frame or engine. Position a block to support the rear wheel.
Noting their position for installation, cut and remove the two cable ties securing the evaporative emissions canister to the frame.
Slide the canister rearwards to allow access to the front hoses. Disconnect the two hoses from the front of the canister and remove the canister from the motorcycle.
